intro: Erepsia nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed erpesia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream sides. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a distinct, hairy texture. Erepsia nudicaulis is notable for its delicate appearance and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
